statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

article.description: UNC Asheville holds on, beats Campbell 69-65
article.headline: UNC Asheville holds on, beats Campbell 69-65
article.linkText: UNC Asheville holds on, beats Campbell 69-65
article.story: BUIES CREEK, N.C. -- David Robertson scored 18 of his 21 in the second half, and Andrew Rowsey added 19 points, to lead UNC Asheville to a 69-65 win over Campbell on Saturday. Jaleel Roberts scored a career-high 14, on 7-of-7 shooting, and tied a career-high with 12 rebounds for Asheville (8-8, 4-1 Big South). The senior recorded his second-career double-double; the first coming in a win against UNC Charlotte on Nov. 30, when he had 12 rebounds and 10 blocked shots. Campbell (7-12, 1-5) led 40-36 with 15:20 left, before Robertson scored 11-straight Bulldogs' points during a 15-4 run which gave Asheville a 51-44 advantage 5 minutes later. A 3-pointer by Reco McCarter and a layup by D.J. Mason cut Campbell's deficit to 55-54 with 6:26 remaining but the Camels would get no closer. Robertson scored five during an 8-1 run over the next 4 minutes to seal it. Curtis Phillips led Campbell with 16 points.
